results.title: Beta1- and beta2-adrenoceptors in basolateral nucleus of amygdala and their roles in consolidation of fear memory in rats.
results.text_hl: Intra-BLA infusion of the @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta1-AR@@@ antagonist @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ or the beta2-AR antagonist @CHEMICAL_ICI_118551 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026777 @@@ICI118551@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Butoxamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002078 @@@butoxamine@@@ produces a severe deficit in 24-h @<m>DISEASE_Pathophobia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C000719212 @@@auditory fear@@@ memory, leaving 1-h memory intact.

citations.NLM: Qu LL, Guo NN, Li BM. Beta1- and beta2-adrenoceptors in basolateral nucleus of amygdala and their roles in consolidation of fear memory in rats. Hippocampus. 2008;18(11):1131-9. PMID: 18680159
citations.BibTeX: @article{18680159, title={Beta1- and beta2-adrenoceptors in basolateral nucleus of amygdala and their roles in consolidation of fear memory in rats.}, author={Qu LL and Guo NN and Li BM}, journal={Hippocampus}, volume={18}, number={11}, pages={1131-9}}

results.title: Bidirectional influence of amygdala beta1-adrenoceptors blockade on cannabinoid signaling in contextual and auditory fear memory.
results.text_hl: Pre-training intra-BLA microinjection of @CHEMICAL_Xamoterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017307 @@@xamoterol@@@ (0.01 and 0.02 microg/@SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@), a partial @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_11554 @@@beta1-adrenoceptor@@@ agonist, or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (0.5 microg/@SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@), a @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_11554 @@@beta1-adrenoceptor@@@ antagonist, decreased freezing behavior, which suggests an @<m>DISEASE_Pathophobia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C000719212 @@@impairment of contextual and auditory fear@@@ retrieval.

citations.NLM: Nasehi M, Shahbazzadeh S, Ebrahimi-Ghiri M, Zarrindast MR. Bidirectional influence of amygdala beta1-adrenoceptors blockade on cannabinoid signaling in contextual and auditory fear memory. J Psychopharmacol. 2018 Aug;32(8):932-942. PMID: 29580129
citations.BibTeX: @article{29580129, title={Bidirectional influence of amygdala beta1-adrenoceptors blockade on cannabinoid signaling in contextual and auditory fear memory.}, author={Nasehi M and Shahbazzadeh S and Ebrahimi-Ghiri M and Zarrindast MR}, journal={J Psychopharmacol}, volume={32}, number={8}, pages={932-942}}
